meanings.definition: To locate or place (something) in a specific position or site.
meanings.sent1: The workers sited the new playground in the park.
meanings.sent2: They sited the picnic area near the lake for easy access.
meanings.sent3: The squirrels sited their acorn stash in the tree hollow.
meanings.sent4: She sited her favorite book on the top shelf for safekeeping.
meanings.sent5: The archaeologists sited the ancient ruins with precision using maps and tools.

meanings.definition: To establish or set up (a building or structure) in a particular location.
meanings.sent1: The company sited their headquarters in the bustling city center.
meanings.sent2: They sited the new school on the outskirts of town.
meanings.sent3: The birds sited their nest on the highest branch of the tree.
meanings.sent4: He sited his tent near the river to enjoy the soothing sound of water.
meanings.sent5: The architect sited the museum strategically to attract visitors from afar.
